page.title: 03SURVEY RESULTS
page.content: It has been recorded that in 1856 there were 448 people living in the area which covered 3650 acres. These included a wheelwright,a tailor,a lock-keeper,a joiner,a shopkeeper, a boot and shoemaker, 2 publicans and 2 farmers. Our group devised a survey which we delivered to the whole village of North Kyme.We did not get all of them back but we were able to use some of the information.We saw that the population had not changed greatly but that jobs varied greatly.There are now several farmers as well as farm labourers. Several people are involved in haulage work and the majority of people work locally. We also found that most people owned their houses and all those that owned a car also had a garage.Most of the crafts mentioned above no longer exist.
